sub_title: Executive Professor; Independent freelance teacher and trainer for AI in Healthcare & Life Sciences; Theme lead Health & Care, Dutch Blockchain Coalition.
summary:
Highly experienced ICT professional with a technical background: more than 34 years of experience in various segments, including academia, business, but notably in Healthcare and Life Sciences (HCLS) and AI in HCLS.

Passionate about making a difference in Healthcare & Life Sciences with technology.

Visionary, strategist, trendsetter. The first IBM Watson Ambassador in Benelux. Driven, analytical, results-oriented and with attention to the connection between strategy and daily practice. Manages not only the content but also the process and the relationship. Communicates easily at all levels of an organization. Guest lecturer, executive professor. Solid networker and board member of various associations and groups.

Specialities: Artificial Intelligence, Big Data and Advanced Analytics, Blockchain, Healthcare, Healthcare Information Technology, Standards, Architecture, Life Sciences, Digital Health, e-Health.

projects.title: Intensive Care 2.0
projects.description:
Intensive Care 2.0 - the social enterprise
Together with the head of the IC unit, I organized a workshop dealing with a modern Health 2.0 way of making communication between patient’s family and doctors much more easier and pleasant. This resulted in a roadmap with functionalities ranging from text-messaging between doctor and family to blogging and video recording of family/doctor conversations. The project is being carried out on the basis of IBM’s Websphere portal framework. Due to this engagement also the ErasmusMC IC unit runs a similar solution. Have a look at http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=o_LNiK5KTgI&feature=youtu.be (Dutch spoken)

projects.title: New infrastructure for core business applications
projects.description:
Sanquin Blood Supply Foundation (http://www.sanquin.nl/sanquin-eng/sqn_home_eng.nsf)is the sole organization in the Netherlands authorized to manage the need for blood and blood products. 
Leader of benchmark at Montpellier. System p architectural design for Sanquin’s core new eProgesa (MAK SYSTEM) application. Published a Whitepaper “Running ePROGESA on an IBM infrastructure”. I won an IBM Professional Excellence Award in 2/2008 for my work.

contributors.headline: Executive Professor; Independent freelance teacher and trainer for AI in Healthcare & Life Sciences; Theme lead Health & Care, Dutch Blockchain Coalition.

projects.title: Creating an on demand infrastructure
projects.description:
Telenor (http://www.telenor.com ) was founded in 1855 and is Norway’s largest telecommunications group, with substantial international mobile operations. Telenor was heavily thwarted by diversity of siloed heterogeneous servers, storage subsystems, system management tools and software, scattered over many countries. 
Chief System Architect and Technical Project Leader for a benchmark at Montpellier, eventually leading in October 2004 to a 5-year IT services and technology agreement with the Telenor and its subsidiary EDB valued at 300 million US$. For this work I earned an IBM Outstanding Technical Achievement Award. The Telenor case was later utilized for an IBM Internal On Demand for Technical Sales Support class.

profile_positions.description: In the Netherlands, the Galenus Medicines Prize and the Galenus Research Prize have been awarded every year since 1992. From 2018, at the 25th anniversary of the Galenus Prizes, the name has been definitively renamed Prix Galien, Prix Galien Pharmaceutical Award and Prix Galien Research Award, following an international example. The *Pharmaceutical Award* is awarded to the most innovative and / or meaningful agent that was introduced in the previous year. The *Research Award* is intended for a young scientist or group of scientists who have done groundbreaking work. The *MedTech Innovation Award* was also introduced in 2018. The MedTech Innovation Award rewards demonstrably valuable innovations in the care of patients, care givers and / or care providers.
profile_positions.title: Member of the Jury Prix Galien - MedTech Awards

profile_positions.description:
Member of the working group Standardization
Goal: the drafting, dissemination and propagation of an unambiguous directive for the Netherlands regarding de facto standardization for Health Care along the Nictiz the 6-layer model. Collaboration with relevant standardization organizations and governments.
OIZ as a bridge between industry and government.
Clarity in choices.
profile_positions.title: Former Chair and Member of the Standardization Working Group

profile_positions.description: COCIR is the European Trade Association representing the medical imaging, health ICT and electromedical industries. Founded in 1959, COCIR is a non-profit association headquartered in Brussels (Belgium) with a China Desk based in Beijing since 2007. COCIR is unique as it brings together the healthcare, IT and telecommunications industries.
profile_positions.title: COCIR Digital Health Committee Vice-Chair
Member of the Editorial Committee of ICT&health
